business.headline: What does Tesla entry mean for India's automotive industry? Nitin Gadkari answersAt the Business Today Mindrush 2025 forum, Nitin Gadkari expressed confidence that India's automotive industry would become the second largest in the world in the next few years.

India on track to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047, says Kumar Mangalam BirlaAditya Birla Group Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla said India is on track for Viksit Bharat 2047, crediting policy stability, infrastructure growth, and economic momentum.

Government withdraws 20% duty on Onion export, to be effective from April 1The Centre has removed the 20 per cent export duty on onions, effective April 1. The duty, imposed to ensure domestic availability, had been in place since September 2024. Despite restrictions, onion exports saw significant growth.

Overconfidence leading to F&O losses for retail investors, says Sebi chiefTuhin Kanta Pandey said that studies conducted by the market regulator, Sebi, show that 90% of retail investors lose money in the futures and options (F&O) segment.

What should market traders be worried about today? Sebi chief answersSebi chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey pointed to India's efforts to negotiate bilateral trade agreements with the United States and pursue free trade agreements with various other nations as examples of strategic responses to global uncertainty.

Marico Chairman Harsh Mariwala says war for talent as crucial as market shareMarico Chairman Harsh Mariwala urged entrepreneurs to focus on building strong teams, saying the competition for skilled professionals is intense.

Motilal Oswal explains why retail investors fail to make money from stock marketMotilal Oswal cautioned that most retail investors are engaging in speculative short-term trading or investing in unknown companies, which often leads to losses.
NSE CEO Ashish Chauhan warns retail investors against derivatives tradingNSE chief Ashish Chauhan also advised investors not to believe market tips and discussions on social media platforms.

Old vs new tax regime: Which one should you opt for in 2025-26?While the old tax regime promotes savings through tax benefits, the new one is simpler, involves less paperwork and reduces the chances of tax fraud.

Old vs new income tax regime: What to choose if you earn Rs 50 lakh per yearTaxpayers should consider a few key factors before making a choice. The old regime allows deductions, whereas the new regime offers lower tax rates but no major deductions.
Sensex closes over 500 points, Nifty above 23,300; NTPC gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 557.45 points to end at 76,905.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 159.75 points to close at 23,350.40.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Smallcap, midcap stocks gain momentum. Good news for mutual funds too?Given the correction, some analysts have indicated that quality smallcap and midcap stocks could start regaining some momentum. But does this apply to smallcap and midcap mutual funds too?

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Morgan Stanley to layoff 2,000 employees to boost efficiencySeveral renowned banks have been reducing their workforce recently as they brace for economic uncertainty following President Donald Trump's newly announced trade tariffs.

Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.
Can AI pick winning stocks on Dalal Street? Check out these toolsOne of the major advantages of using AI is that it takes care of the labour-intensive aspects of trading efficiently, as per experts.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to tackle economic slowdownNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

Sensex climbs over 600 points. Check key reasons behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 604.77 points to trade at 76,952.83 at 12:37 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 175.35 points to 23,366. Adding to the cheer was the continued rally in smallcap and midcap segments.

Bajaj Finance shares rally over 3% to reach record high, analysts bullishShares of the non-banking financial company rose 3.5% in early trade to reach a day's high of 9,070. At around 10:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.43% higher at Rs 8,891.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
RVNL shares rise 4% as railway PSU bags Rs 555 crore project. Check detailsThe shares of RVNL were trading 4.18% higher at Rs 373 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This woman earned $350 million a day but lost $3.6 billion in 3 daysMarina Bumdiman had accumulated a fortune of $7.5 billion, making her the richest woman in Indonesia. However, the rapid rise was followed by an equally sharp fall. In just three days, her net worth was cut in half, wiping out $3.6 billion.

Ola Electric shares jump over 6% after clarification on February sales dataOla Electric Mobility's share price rose over 6% on the Bombay Stock Exchange in early trade after an important clarification.

Accenture revenue forecast hits IT stocks, Infosys, Wipro fallAccenture, which is seen as a key indicator for the Indian IT sector, raised the lower end of its annual revenue forecast but kept the upper end unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag markets down after 4-day rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 98.30 points to 76,249.76, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 21.85 points to 23,168.80 as of 9:25 am.

Ola Electric explains February sales mismatch: Temporary backlog in registrationsOla Electric addressed concerns about the mismatch in a stock exchange filing, saying that daily registrations have now exceeded 50% of its three-month daily sales average.

Sensex, Nifty opening predictions on March 21: What to expect todayBSE, NSE today: Nifty has posted gains for four straight sessions this week, marking its longest winning streak in nearly seven weeks.

Stocks to watch on March 21: TCS, HUL, Zomato, Adani Enterprises, Jio FinancialSeveral stocks will be in focus today due to recent developments. These include Hindustan Unilever (HUL), Jio Financial, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, TCS, Bajaj Finance, Zomato, and others.

Planning taxes for FY2026? Which regime to pick- old or new?The old tax regime offers over 70 deductions and exemptions, including HRA, LTA, Section 80C, 80D, home loan interest, and education loan interest. Meanwhile, the new tax regime has simplified slabs but does not offer these deductions.

US stock market opening: Wall Street opens lower as tariff concerns resurfaceDarden Restaurants Inc. was the biggest gainer, climbing by 6.52%, at the opening bell. Others in the green zone included Jabil Inc., up by 4.09%, Solventum Corp., which rose by 2.41% and TransDigm Group Inc., which climbed by 2.15%.

EPFO speeds up claim processing, 60% settled via automated systemTo further quicken the process, EPFO has automated claims related to medical emergencies, housing, studies, and marriage costs. With this system in place, claims are now processed within just three days.

Daughter's future? Which is better- Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana or ELSS?SSY offers 8.2% as an annual interest rate. Investors can invest a minimum of Rs 250, while the maximum limit is Rs 1.5 lakh per year. Further, this scheme allows tax benefits under Sector 80C of the Income Tax Act 1961.

Money after divorce: How courts calculate alimonyAlimony in India does not follow a fixed formula. Courts consider various factors such as the financial position of both spouses, their earning potential, and their contributions to the marriage.

Jio Financial, Allianz likely reach deal for insurance joint venture in India: ReportJio Financial Services has reached an initial deal for a joint venture with Allianz SE to form an insurance business in India.
Sensex ends 900 points higher, Nifty over 23,100; Airtel gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 899.01 points to close at 76,348.06, while the NSE Nifty50 added 283.05 points to end at 23,190.65.

Worker regrets moving from Noida to Bengaluru for Rs 30,000 hike. Here's whyIn a recent social media post, a corporate employee described Bengaluru as "dirty, unorganised," with bad roads and the worst traffic. Apart from infrastructure issues, the worker also mentioned feeling a "north vs south" divide in everyday interactions.

Air India in talks to buy more widebody jets from Airbus and Boeing: ReportThe potential order is expected to be worth billions of dollars and could help the airline expand its long-haul fleet as it undergoes a major transformation under Tata Group ownership.

entertainment.headline: Karan Aujla goes Tauba Tauba, Disha Patani dazzles at IPL 2025 openingKaran Aujla and Disha Patani delivered electrifying performances at the IPL 2025 opening ceremony on Saturday. Hosted by Shah Rukh Khan, the event also featured a mesmerising act by Shreya Ghoshal.

Yash's Toxic confirmed for March 2026 releaseKannada superstar Yash's highly anticipated film Toxic has officially set its release date. The film is scheduled to hit the silver screen in March 2026.

Mahesh Babu and Rajamouli join tree plantation drive in Odisha. PicsIn a bid to promote environmental awareness, actor Mahesh Babu and film-maker SS Rajamouli joined hands for a tree-planting initiative in Odisha. Unseen photos of the event have now taken the internet by storm.

Prithviraj says Empuraan 'not Rs 100 crore film where Rs 80 crore goes to salaries'Prithviraj Sukumaran ensured L2: Empuraan's budget was spent on filmmaking, not salaries. Neither he nor Mohanlal charged a fee. He also revealed Akshay Kumar worked for free on Selfiee.

No regrets: Jugal Hansraj on career setbacks, typecasting and new beginningsJugal Hansraj was praised for his performance in Nadaaniyan. In an exclusive interview with us, he shared insights on Bollywood's evolution, his career struggles, and overcoming typecasting.

Anirudh Ravichander rehearses Leo's Badass ahead of CSK vs MI matchAnirudh Ravichander confirmed performing at the CSK vs MI match on Sunday in Chennai's Chepauk stadium. The music composer and singer was seen rehearsing Leo's Badass on Saturday.

Mahira Sharma shuts down dating rumours with cricketer Mohammed SirajMahira Sharma has addressed rumours of a romantic relationship with cricketer Mohammed Siraj. Both have issued statements debunking the claims, urging an end to such speculations.

Avneet Kaur once beat up a boy with bat for misbehaving on Holi: He deserved itAvneet Kaur recalled beating up a boy for misbehaving with her on Holi, being bullied at school, and facing misconceptions about her attitude. She is gearing up for the release of Love in Vietnam, India-Vietnam's first film collaboration.

Tamannaah Bhatia's Odela 2 locks April release, actors shares striking new posterTamannaah Bhatia's much-awaited film Odela 2 is set to release in April. The actor announced the release date with a new poster on March 22.

Randeep Hooda shot Veer Savarkar with fractured knee, admits being 'hangry' on setActor Randeep Hooda revealed that he shot Swatantrya Veer Savarkar despite having a fractured knee. In a heartfelt post marking the film's first anniversary, he opened up about the intense physical pain he endured during the shoot.

Prithviraj Sukumaran admits nepotism advantage: My surname got me my first filmActor Prithviraj Sukumaran openly admitted that his entry into the film industry was facilitated by nepotism. The actor acknowledged that his first role was secured due to his surname's influence.

SRK motivates KKR players before IPL 2025 opener: Be happy, be healthyShah Rukh Khan gave a pep talk to KKR ahead of their IPL 2025 opener, urging players to stay happy and healthy. He will open the grand ceremony at Eden Gardens before performances by Shreya Ghoshal, Karan Aujla, and Disha Patani.

Sunny Deol's Jaat trailer release postponed, makers to announce new date soonThe trailer of Sunny Deol's Jaat was initially scheduled for release on March 22. However, on Saturday, the makers announced that it has been postponed, with a new release date to be revealed soon.

Ali Sethi's Pasoori is a global hit, but his mother doesn't like itPakistani singer Ali Sethi's Pasoori may be a global hit, but his mother, Jugnoo Mohsin, isn't a fan. She prefers his traditional Punjabi songs and told him so, despite the track's popularity among music lovers.

Aamir Khan on Laal Singh Chaddha failure: I ran a lot, the film didn'tAamir Khan humorously addresses the failure of his last film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in a light-hearted video where he guesses badly described plots of his movies.

Akshay Kumar confirms Kesari 2 release date, hints at a story of revolutionAkshay Kumar confirms Kesari 2. The film is set to release on April 18. The sequel may explore the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. It also stars R Madhavan and Ananya Panday.

Ranveer Singh brings Rocky Randhawa's energy to wedding bash. WatchRanveer Singh's dance videos from a wedding went viral as he grooved to his hit songs. He was seen in his rugged Dhurandhar look as he enjoyed the celebrations.

CBI closes two cases linked to Sushant Singh Rajput's death: SourcesThe closure reports, submitted by the CBI to a Mumbai court, say that no evidence was found to suggest any foul play in Sushant Singh Rajput's death.

3-judge panel to probe 'cash at home' charge against Delhi judge Yashwant VarmaSanjiv Khanna has formed a three-member panel to probe Delhi High Court judge Justice Yashwant Varma over the 'cash at home' controversy. Meanwhile, the Delhi High Court Chief Justice has been directed not to assign him any judicial work.

Kerala leads the way on public safety, but stray dog menace bites: GDB surveyKerala's public safety measures may be a howling success, but 96% of Kerala residents oppose the presence of stray dogs, shows India Today's Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey.

Gujarat engineer detained in Qatar, Indian Mission in touch with family: SourcesIndian engineer Amit Gupta has been detained by Qatari authorities as part of an ongoing investigation. The Indian Embassy in Qatar is in contact with his family, lawyer, and local authorities. Officials have assured that they are providing all possible assistance and closely monitoring the case.

MK Stalin-led panel passes resolution, seeks delimitation freeze for 25 more yearsThe Joint Action Committee (JAC) on delimitation, led by Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin, adopted a resolution demanding transparency in the delimitation process. The JAC urged the Union Government to extend the freeze on parliamentary constituencies based on the 1971 Census for another 25 years.

BJP leaders denounced the statement as an insult to Rajputs and India's history, demanding an apology from the party.

12-year-old builds nuclear fusion reactor, gets visit from FBIJackson Oswalt, a 12-year-old teen from Memphis, US, built a nuclear fusion reactor in his bedroom and made a Guinness World Record for the youngest person to achieve fusion. Later on, he got a visit from the FBI to make sure all was good.

Should alcohol be banned? This is what India has to saySome states in India have tried to ban the sale of alcohol and are seeing mixed results. Though a complete ban never succeeds, India Today's inaugural Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey found 82 per cent of the respondents supported prohibition.

Jaishankar calls world order a western myth: Won't go around singing paeansS Jaishankar said even though the world order was on the threshold of change, India won't go around 'singing paeans' to the world if challenges arise.

'Kitne aadmi the?' Not enough to remember today's films byBollywood's golden era gave us iconic dialogues, music, and moments. Today, films have become forgettable and do not have a lasting impact. Experts blame weak writing, fleeting music, and OTT overload for cinema's declining recall value.

Stabbed in heart, limbs cut off to fit in drum: Autopsy of UP man killed by wifeSaurabh Rajput was allegedly drugged and murdered on March 4. His wife and her lover then hid his body in a cement-filled drum before they left for a vacation.

Trump told Sunita Williams will get just Rs 430 per day for overtime. He reactsSunita Williams and Butch Wilmore spent an additional 278 days in space after their week-long mission in June last year turned into a nine-month ordeal. Here is how much they will get in overtime pay.

While KKR have their tried and tested line-ups and combinations, RCB have several players making their debuts for the side on Saturday.

From 2008 to 2025: Meet the ever-lasting nine IPL OGsIn the 17-year-long history of the Indian Premier League (IPL), a few players have been a part of the inaugural season and will also be seen playing in the upcoming IPL 2025. Here's the complete list of nine such players.

Lions sign CB Avonte Maddox to one-year deal, agent confirmsThe Detroit Lions have added veteran cornerback Avonte Maddox on a one-year contract. The move strengthens their secondary as they look to build on last season's defensive improvements.

Report: Aaron Rodgers set to visit steelers on friday amid trade speculationVeteran quarterback Aaron Rodgers is reportedly meeting with the Pittsburgh Steelers, fueling speculation about a potential move. The visit could signal major changes for both Rodgers and the Steelers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
